p: Experiments were carried out under laboratory conditions 25–28 °C and a photoperiod of 12 h light followed by 12 h dark (12 L: 12D) against laboratory-reared third instar larvae of Anopheles gambiae ( s.s.) and wild population of An. arabiensis. Mortality was recorded after 24 h of exposure, then larval food (yeast powder for An. gambiae) was added for those alive after 24 h, next mortality was recorded after 48 h and 72 h.
